intro: Philippia leeana, commonly known as the narrow-leaf philippia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with a distinctive spurred petal, and it produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. Philippia leeana is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
